intro: Praecoxanthus, commonly known as the early yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Praecoxanthus thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens.
